result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Pretrial 10-18-22 at 11:30 AM and Return date 12-29-22 at 10:00 AM

Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. No possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages. Not operate motor vehicle without a valid license. Standard felony conditions. - letter mailed to defendant with bond form for signature.

11:06 AM Cases called: 22CF496, 21TR6833R, and 21TR6834. Defendant Jay A Bean appeared by phone.  Prosecuting attorney Jonathan Ross in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant stated his ride for today fell through. Waived reading of complaint. Advisement of rights. Court set $500.00 signature bond. Not operate motor vehicle without a valid license. No possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages. Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. Standard felony conditions. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. Not guilty plea entered in the TR cases they will continue to track. Signed bond due back in 10 days. 11:15 AM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Return date scheduled for December 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on August 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.
